item.title: Azure South Africa North Connectivity Issues
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Connectivity Issue in Azure South Africa North Region

Our team is investigating a degraded connectivity issue towards the Azure South Africa North region which could also affect deployment changes. We are in contact with Azure to assess the actual impact. We will post an update within the next hour. Summary: Our team is currently investigating an issue with degraded connectivity in the Azure South Africa North region, which may affect deployment changes. We are in contact with Azure to determine the impact and will provide an update soon.

Mar 14, 11:53 UTC
Monitoring - Azure has confirmed the connectivity impact on South Africa North region. We will be monitoring the situation and we will post an update within the next 2 hours

Mar 14, 11:33 UTC
Investigating - Our team is investigating a degraded connectivity issue towards the Azure South Africa North which could also affect deployment changes. We are in contact with Azure to assess the actual impact. We will post an update within the next hour

item.title: Elastic Docker Registry - Production Database Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Maintenance for Docker Registry Web Interface

We will be performing maintenance on the production database for the docker registry web interface during this window. We expect this procedure to take approximately 30 minutes. During the maintenance window, users who visit the docker registry web interface (https://www.docker.elastic.co) in a browser may see errors for a few moments that resolve after a refresh. Actual docker operations, such as `docker pull`, will continue to work without interruption. Summary: Maintenance scheduled for the docker registry web interface, minimal impact expected on users.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 13, 17:00 - 17:30 UTC

Mar 6, 17:03 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing maintenance on the production database for the docker registry web interface during this window. We expect this procedure to take approximately 30 minutes.

During the maintenance window, users who visit the docker registry web interface (https://www.docker.elastic.co) in a browser may see errors for a few moments that resolve after a refresh. Actual docker operations, such as `docker pull`, will continue to work without interruption.

item.title: Capacity provisioning issue in GCP asia-southeast1
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Capacity Provisioning Issue in GCP asia-southeast1

We are aware of the issue with capacity provisioning in GCP asia-southeast1. Our teams are investigating. Summary: The capacity provisioning issue in GCP asia-southeast1 is undergoing investigation, indicating a major outage with platform downtime.

Mar 4, 01:28 UTC
Investigating - We are aware of the issue with capacity provisioning in GCP asia-southeast1. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: AWS N. Virginia (us-east-1) IP Additions
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Elastic Cloud IP Address Update

Summary: Elastic Cloud is reserving additional ingress and egress public IP addresses to the AWS N. Virginia region. Additional IP addresses will be added for outbound and inbound communication from March 12, 2024. Customers may need to update firewall rules for inbound and outbound network traffic.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 12, 10:00 - 10:05 UTC

Dec 13, 15:10 UTC
Scheduled - Elastic Cloud is reserving additional ingress and egress public IP addresses to the AWS N. Virginia (us-east-1) region. These IP addresses will be used for public communication over the Internet with Elastic Cloud after March 12, 2024.

Whatâ€™s Changing:

Outbound communication
Starting from March 12, 2024, we will be adding the below-mentioned set of IP addresses used for outbound communication from the Elastic Cloud AWS N. Virginia (us-east-1) region towards the public Internet:

3.93.116.88/32
3.214.231.41/32
34.199.113.58/32

The full list of outbound IP addresses for AWS us-east-1 region will include:

3.93.116.88/32
3.214.231.41/32
3.218.187.232/32
3.220.12.171/32
3.223.37.231/32
18.214.168.74/32
34.199.113.58/32
34.205.88.186/32
34.237.57.214/32
35.168.128.28/32
35.171.109.44/32
44.210.37.226/32
52.202.72.126/32
54.161.173.12/32
54.173.213.121/32
174.129.140.127/32

Inbound communication
Starting from March 12, 2024, we will be adding the below-mentioned set of IP addresses used for inbound communication from the public Internet towards the Elastic Cloud AWS N. Virginia (us-east-1) region:

3.212.44.6/32
34.198.138.2/32
44.195.226.190/32

The full list of inbound IP addresses for AWS us-east-1 region will include:

3.212.44.6/32
3.215.12.84/32
3.234.152.120/32
18.204.141.221/32
34.198.138.2/32
34.231.108.253/32
34.234.143.15/32
44.195.226.190/32
44.213.199.140/32
52.204.179.207/32
54.80.119.44/32
54.160.25.132/32

How does this impact you?
If your organization does not restrict network traffic from or towards Elastic Cloud, there is no impact to you and you do not need to make any changes.

If your organization does restrict inbound or outbound network traffic, you will need to update any relevant IP-based rules or firewall rules in your environments to include the above IPs before March 12, 2024. Failure to do so may result in traffic being blocked by your firewalls.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact our support team (support@elastic.co) for guidance or assistance.

item.title: Some deployments are unable to scale in GCP us-central1
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scaling Deployment Issue

Summary: The service had an issue preventing customer attempts to scale deployments in GCP us-central1, but it has been resolved and is being monitored.

Feb 15, 00:18 UTC
Resolved - The service has returned to an operational state and customers should be able to scale deployments without interruption.

Feb 14, 22:50 UTC
Monitoring - We are aware of an issue that, in certain scenarios, may have prevented customer attempts to scale deployments in GCP us-central1. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring for any additional impact. We will post an update within an hour.

item.title: Issues with Login have been identified.
item.content:encoded:
Medium - Login Issues for Cloud.elastic.co

Summary: Customers are experiencing issues with login to cloud.elastic.co. The company is aware of the problem and is currently investigating.

Feb 8, 16:12 UTC
Resolved - Our teams have completed their investigation and as a result the incident has been resolved.

Feb 8, 15:49 UTC
Investigating - We are aware of customers experiencing issues with login to cloud.elastic.co. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: AWS Sydney (ap-southeast-2) Deployment Metrics - Outage
item.content:encoded:
Jan 30, 00:22 UTC
Resolved - We have completed our work to restore access to the deployment metrics service in AWS Sydney (ap-southeast-2)

Jan 29, 23:03 UTC
Monitoring - We have identified the cause of the deployment metrics service outage and have implemented a fix to our backend metrics cluster. We will continue monitoring for further impact and provide an update in one hour, or sooner if there is a change in status.

Jan 29, 21:52 UTC
Identified - We are experiencing a service outage with deployment metrics in our AWS Sydney (ap-southeast-2) region. Our team is currently working to restore the service. Disk and CPU/memory metrics for deployments in the AWS Sydney region may be unavailable in the Elastic Cloud console. Our next update will be in one hour.

item.title: Potential impact to deployment scaling or creation in Azure South Africa North
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 02:41 UTC
Resolved - Microsoft informed us that they have resolved the issue. We have confirmed that we are now able to add capacity as needed.

Jan 25, 00:12 UTC
Update - Microsoft is continuing its investigation into the issue. We will provide further updates as we get them.

Jan 24, 23:03 UTC
Identified - An incident in Azure South Africa North may prevent the creation of new deployments or scaling up existing deployments in this region. Microsoft acknowledged the issue and confirmed it is impacting multiple customers in the region. We will provide further updates as we get them.

There is no impact on availability or connectivity for existing deployments.

item.title: Azure Central US Connectivity Issues
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 05:19 UTC
Resolved - The issue has been resolved by Azure. Operations are back to normal in Azure Central US.

Jan 18, 23:54 UTC
Monitoring - We're continuing to monitor for updates from Azure in regards to connectivity issues affecting users in the Central US region. No updates from Azure as of the last update.

Jan 18, 22:38 UTC
Investigating - We've been alerted by Azure that they are experiencing connectivity issues in the Central US region starting at 19:04 UTC. Some of our infrastructure has been affected, and we will monitor and update as the situation progresses.

item.title: Azure North Europe (Zone 3) Connectivity Issues
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 21:44 UTC
Resolved - Azure has reported the incident as resolved. We have seen no further impact.

Jan 18, 19:45 UTC
Monitoring - We are monitoring the region and will resolve the incident when Azure has updated their status page as resolved.

Jan 18, 19:44 UTC
Investigating - Due to an incident reported by Azure on their status page, several reboots on our platform occurred. All affected instances have since recovered. Our alerting notified us of the incident at approximately 6PM UTC time, and our instances reported back as being healthy at approximately 7:15PM UTC. We will continue to monitor the Azure Status Page and update here accordingly.

item.title: Deployment logging and metrics delayed in Azure Virginia (azure-eastus2)
item.content:encoded:
Dec 26, 17:01 UTC
Resolved - This Incident has been resolved.

Dec 26, 16:04 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and and we are monitoring the results

Our next update will be in one hour.

Dec 26, 15:31 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified, and a fix for the problem has been deployed.

Dec 26, 15:04 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Our next update will be in one hour.

Dec 26, 15:01 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Dec 26, 14:07 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Our next update will be in one hour.

Dec 26, 13:00 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating delays with deployment logs and metrics ingestion in Azure Virginia (azure-eastus2). The delay can also potentially cause failures allocating new capacity in this region affecting deployment creation and topology changes.

Our next update will be in one hour.

item.title: Minor delays with usage reports
item.content:encoded:
Dec 20, 09:42 UTC
Resolved - There are no delays for usage reports in the user console and APIs for more than 2 hours. The service is fully operational.

Dec 20, 09:18 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Dec 20, 01:06 UTC
Monitoring - We've deployed a fix to correct the delays. It will take some time for processing to catch up. We are monitoring closely and will provide another update when complete.

Dec 19, 23:59 UTC
Identified - We have identified the cause of delays and are working on a fix. An update will be provided once deployed.

Dec 19, 23:10 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue that is causing some customers to experience minor delays to their usage reports in the user console and APIs.

item.title: Deployment logging delayed in Azure Virginia (azure-eastus2)
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 16:01 UTC
Resolved - We have identified and resolved the issue causing delays in deployment log ingestion and no more delays are observed.

Dec 18, 15:45 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating potential delays with deployment log ingestion in Azure Virginia (azure-eastus2). The delay in log ingestion can also potentially cause failures allocating new capacity in this region affecting deployment creation and topology changes. Our next update will be in one hour.

item.title: Difficulties with scaling up deployments
item.content:encoded:
Dec 5, 15:01 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved by engineers.

Dec 5, 14:27 UTC
Investigating - We are seeing a reoccurrence of the issues that may result in difficulties with scaling up deployments in gcp-us-west2. Our engineers are investigating. Our next up will be posted in 1 hour.

item.title: Identified difficulties with scaling up deployments
item.content:encoded:
Dec 5, 13:22 UTC
Resolved - Our engineers have resolved the issue with possible difficulties with scaling up deployments in gcp-us-west2

Dec 5, 12:33 UTC
Investigating - We have identified that some customers may encounter difficulties with scaling up deployments in the region gcp-us-west2. Our engineers are tackling this issue and are working towards resolution. Our next update will be posted in 1 hour.

item.title: Unable to create deployments using certain 7.17.x versions
item.content:encoded:
Nov 30, 06:26 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 30, 03:40 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Nov 30, 03:28 UTC
Monitoring - We are aware of an issue that impacted Elastic Cloud users ability to create new deployments with most versions of 7.17 beginning at 14:03 UTC on November 29th. Specifically, users were unable to create new deployments with versions between 7.17.1 and 7.17.15. Existing deployments were not impacted in any way. A fix for the issue has been implemented, and deployment creation for all 7.17 versions is now working. We will continue to monitor the situation before resolving this incident.

item.title: Impacted deployment orchestration in AWS Sydney (ap-southeast-2)
item.content:encoded:
Nov 26, 17:54 UTC
Resolved - The incident has been resolved.

Nov 26, 17:27 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented. Deployment topology and configuration updates as well as creation of new deployments is working properly again.

We are continuing to monitor the situation before resolving this incident.

Nov 26, 16:47 UTC
Investigating - We are experiencing an issue with deployment topology and configuration updates as well as the creation of new deployments in the AWS Sydney (ap-southeast-2) region. Availability of deployments in the region is not impacted.

We will provide an update within 1 hour.

item.title: MFA challenge interruption
item.content:encoded:
Nov 16, 18:32 UTC
Resolved - No new MFA failures observed in the past hour. Resolving the incident.

Nov 16, 17:29 UTC
Monitoring - We've fixed the MFA challenge and have confirmed logins using MFA are working again. You may need to refresh your browser if you are still experiencing the problem. We'll continue to monitor for 1h and close the incident if no new failures are reported.

Nov 16, 16:29 UTC
Identified - We have identified an issue with our MFA challenge verification process and we are actively working on mitigating the issue, we will post another update in an hour.

item.title: Deployments issue in Azure Central India AZ1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 16, 13:19 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 16, 07:23 UTC
Monitoring - Capacity to move affected deployments has been provided by Azure. Instance migration to new nodes is almost complete. We are monitoring the recovery of the last remaining deployments.

We'll provide an update in 2 hours.

Nov 16, 05:39 UTC
Identified - The cloud service provider has identified the issue and working on remediation. Some of the deployments are still pending migration to the new nodes. We will provide and update in one hour.

Nov 16, 04:40 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing issues with deployments in azure-centralindia-1. Single zone deployments in this zone may be unavailable, while deployments spanning more than 1 zone, will still operate but with degraded performance. We are currently working to mitigate the problem by moving deployments to other instances in the affected zone. We will provide another update in an hour.

item.title: Degraded performance in AWS us-east-1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 14, 15:13 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 14, 12:04 UTC
Monitoring - The issue has been mitigated on all the affected hosts. We will be monitoring the situation for the next two hours

Nov 14, 10:28 UTC
Update - After deeper investigation, we determined that the impacted hosts were closer to 3%. The mitigation is on-going and affected deployments may see a brief drop in cross service communication, such as Kibana, Enterprise Search, APM Server to Elasticsearch

Nov 14, 09:58 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Nov 14, 09:49 UTC
Identified - We have identified an anomaly with high CPU usage of one of our components which affects 40% of hosts in AWS us-east-1. Our engineering team is mitigating the problem. We will post an update in 2 hours

item.title: Deployment topology updates impaired for some deployments
item.content:encoded:
Nov 11, 12:46 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 10, 15:22 UTC
Monitoring - A remediation has been applied and deployment topology updates should be working properly again for the affected deployments.

We'll monitor the situation for one more hour before resolving this incident.

Nov 10, 14:13 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on fixing the issue.

We will provide an update within the next 2 hours.

Nov 10, 12:16 UTC
Identified - Deployment topology updates (scale in and scale out) in the Cloud console UI is currently impaired for a limited number of deployments due to a recent change. Availability of deployments is not impacted.

The issue has been identified and corrective measures are being implemented.

We will provide an update within the next 2 hours.

item.title: Degraded Connectivity in AWS us-east-1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 9, 08:00 UTC
Resolved - Between 8:00 and 8:20 UTC, we experienced degraded connectivity for a small percent of requests in AWS us-east-1. It has already been resolved.

item.title: Global Managed Testing Infrastructure Degraded Performance
item.content:encoded:
Nov 2, 16:00 UTC
Resolved - We are aware of some circumstances where Synthetics monitors would result in `down` status due to the website being tested having uncaught JavaScript errors or promise rejections. A new version has been released to all Synthetics managed locations to resolve the same.

item.title: Primary Datastore Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
Oct 30, 01:40 UTC
Completed - Verification has been completed & we're happy with the results. We're closing this maintenance window now, as normal if you notice any issues please contact Support (via support@elastic.co).

Oct 30, 01:06 UTC
Verifying - Upgrade has been completed. We're verifying the upgrade now & making sure all our internal services have reconnected as expected.

Oct 30, 00:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 9, 00:09 UTC
Scheduled - We will be upgrading our primary administrative data store during this window.

We've thoroughly tested our upgrade procedure across our deployment pipeline, and against copies of our production stores. We expect this procedure to take less than 3 hours to complete.

During the maintenance window, customers will see delayed updates to their billing information & may not be able to access the Cloud Console (https://cloud.elastic.co/)

We're not expecting any impact on connectivity to customer deployments during this maintenance window, you should contact Support (via support@elastic.co) as usual if you notice any impact.

item.title: ESS Network Maintenance (AWS us-east-1)
item.content:encoded:
Oct 26, 10:46 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Oct 26, 09:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 19, 15:35 UTC
Scheduled - We previously communicated that additional egress public IP addresses were planned to be added in the Elastic Cloud AWS us-east-1 region. These IP addresses are now deployed and active.

Starting on October 26th, we will begin to shift larger portions of network traffic to use these new egress public IP addresses.

What's Changing?

Starting on October 26th, we will begin sending network traffic from the Elastic Cloud AWS us-east-1 region towards the public internet through this full list of outbound IP addresses:

174.129.140.127/32
3.223.37.231/32
34.237.57.214/32
35.168.128.28/32
44.210.37.226/32
54.161.173.12/32
54.173.213.121/32
3.218.187.232/32
34.205.88.186/32
35.171.109.44/32

How does this impact you?

If your organization does not restrict inbound network traffic from Elastic Cloud towards your environment, there is no impact to you and you do not need to make any changes.

If your organization does restrict inbound network traffic and has not yet allowed the above IP addresses after our previous announcement, you will need to update any relevant IP-based rules or firewall rules in your environments to include the above IPs before October 26th. Failure to do so may result in traffic from Elastic Cloud towards your environments being blocked by your firewalls.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact our support team (support@elastic.co) for guidance or assistance.

item.title: Impacted Deployment Orchestration in Azure Johannesburg (azure-southafricanorth) Region
item.content:encoded:
Oct 25, 10:49 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. All functionality has been restored and deployment orchestration (create/edit/restart/delete) is fully operational again in the Azure Johannesburg (azure-southafricanorth) Region.

Oct 25, 10:20 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been put in place and all connectivity has been restored successfully.
Deployment topology and configuration updates as well as creation of new deployments is working properly again.

We are continuing to monitor the situation before resolving this incident.

Oct 25, 09:00 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and corrective measures are being implemented.

The next update will follow within 1 hour.

Oct 25, 08:17 UTC
Investigating - Deployment topology and configuration updates as well as creation of new deployments currently impaired in Azure johannesburg (azure-southafricanorth) region.

Availability of deployments in that region is not impacted.
Our team has identified a connection issue in the administration component towards one of its state stores and is working on restoring connectivity.

We will provide an update within 1 hour.

item.title: Customers having connectivity issues with Kibana.
item.content:encoded:
Oct 24, 12:49 UTC
Resolved - Currently, no Kibana instances are affected by this incident across our fleet.
This incident has been resolved.

Oct 24, 12:04 UTC
Monitoring - The team has applied a patch to mitigate the connectivity issue. Affected deployments returned to a healthy state.

We are currently monitoring the situation.

Oct 24, 10:08 UTC
Update - The team remains working on patching the affected hosts, impacting a small subset of Kibana instances hosted in Azure regions.

We will update this issue over the next hour.

Oct 24, 09:10 UTC
Update - The team remains working on patching the affected hosts, impacting a small subset of Kibana instances hosted in Azure regions.

We will update this issue over the next hour.

Oct 24, 00:04 UTC
Identified - We've identified why some deployments may be unable to connect to Kibana.

We're currently working on patching the affected hosts.

We'll update this issue when patching is complete.

Oct 23, 19:47 UTC
Investigating - A few customers are having issues with connecting to Kibana. Customers may experience errors attempting to login.

We're currently investigating this issue and will provide a further update over the next hour.

item.title: Billing pages are down
item.content:encoded:
Oct 18, 13:49 UTC
Resolved - Problem solved and the API and pages are working fine. A fix to prevent this incident from happening again will be done by the owning team.

Oct 18, 13:11 UTC
Identified - The billing API and billing usage pages within the user console are currently unavailable. We are working to mitigate the underlying issue.
